As we look back on our 10-day trip, this was certainly the most memorable of our journey. Wish that our time in Riverton were a little longer. Our evening relaxing on the front porch of this rustic and charming back cabin was a serene and delightful highlight. The space is comfortable and provided everything we needed for a good night of rest. I was excited to use the outdoor shower, but we arrived in the evening and left early in the morning and didn't get the chance. Brushing our teeth at the the outdoor "sink" in the morning while the chickens roamed around at our feet was so much fun. Getting to feed the herd of cows was an exciting experience for me and I thank Morgan for her time with us. Dee Ann is a beautifully kind woman and a totally wonderful hostess who provided us a most delicious homemade breakfast with organic food either grown on the farm or traded with neighbors. Steve's stories were entertaining and our conversations with him and the entire family were easy, friendly, and familiar. We felt totally comfortable and welcome on their farm and appreciate the kindness they extended during our short time with them. This place is a real gem in the middle of Wyoming and the perfect example of what we hope for when we choose an Airbnb. Thanks for everything!

Also, and this was just a nostalgic piece for me, I surprisingly enjoyed using a VCR again. Be kind and rewind!

Can we go back now?!?!
My daughterand I were hungry & EXHAUSTED when we got to the area. Paulette had excellent food recommendations and a comfortable, welcoming place for us to sleep.
After some food and a nap, we got to know the locals (Otis the donkey, Whiskey the mare & Griz the dog). Even my dogs (one of which is a rescue and is scared of most other dogs) loved Griz! We enjoyed a wonderful night under the stars next to a fire. I can't imagine anything closer to heaven!
And Paulette was friendly and just the sweetest!
The grain silo was a fun addition to our summer road trip! And the facilities were so clean! And where on earth did that mattress come from?! I have got to get me one of those!
And my dogs LOVED all the space they had to roam on! (Acres and acres of pasture land.) Getting out to the middle of nowhere, where they could run off leash to their little puppy hearts' content, sniff all the sniffs and explore was a highlight of their trip!
Next time I need to escape daily life... I know where I'm heading... Back to where Otis brays from his paddock when he sees me! (He really knows how to make a girl feel special!)

I would not suggest this home when it's winter or for a lot of privacy.

Good things about this space: it was warm, the thermostat is accessible, beds were comfortable, basic cooking possible (e.g. scrambled eggs). The host is friendly and quick to respond.

There are several small discrepancies between the online directions and correspondence with the host (for example where to park), which can feel confusing. The bathroom door is not actually a door so be sure the people you stay here with are ok with hearing you poop. There was a used wine glass by the bed when we arrived.
All in all fine for a short stay in the area.

This is a charming, quaint spot! It’s nice and secluded while still having the comfort of just a couple of houses nearby.
The beds are so comfy and the appliances are new. Nice to have an in-unit washer/dryer for long term stays and just in general. Bathroom is very clean and shampoo, conditioner, and shower gel is provided!
Kitchen has just the right amount of items you would need, along with a dishwasher. My friend and I went to Smith’s (nice grocery store 5 min away) to load up on groceries/snacks and it was nice to have a fridge/freezer to store everything in (yay for our fruit and ice cream, respectively). It’s not the biggest TV, but you can angle it which is nice! The couch is quite comfy.
Maybe the most charming thing is the bird noises intermittently throughout the day! We heard owls often but unfortunately never saw one. A very cheerful and peaceful background noise. Also one night we heard some cows moo! It was simultaneously adorable and hysterical!
Side note:
-Was mildly amusing to open/close the chain on the gate whenever we left/returned. Not difficult at all, just didn’t expect it!
